summary: This document is the formal plea agreement and sentencing terms for Jeffrey Epstein in Palm Beach County Circuit Court. It details his guilty plea to two felony charges, the resulting sentences of incarceration and community control, and the extensive conditions of his registration as a sexual offender under Florida law.

persons.name: Jeffrey E. Epstein
persons.context: The defendant who pleads guilty to two felony charges: solicitation of prostitution and procuring a person under 18 for prostitution. He is sentenced to jail time and community control, and is designated a sexual offender.

events.title: Epstein's Guilty Plea and Sentencing
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein pleads guilty to two felony charges (solicitation of prostitution and procuring a person under 18 for prostitution) and is sentenced. The sentence includes 12 months in jail for the first charge and 18 months of community control (with the first 6 months in jail) for the second, to be served consecutively.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein pleaded guilty to felony solicitation of prostitution (Case No. 06CF009454AMB) and felony procuring a person under 18 for prostitution (Case No. 08CF009381AMB).

He was sentenced to 12 months in the Palm Beach County Detention Facility for the first charge and 18 months of Community Control (with the first 6 months in jail) for the second, to be served consecutively.
As a special condition of community control, Epstein was to have no unsupervised contact with minors, and the supervising adult had to be approved by the Department of Corrections.
Epstein was formally designated as a Sexual Offender pursuant to Florida Statute 943.0435, triggering lifelong registration requirements and numerous restrictions.

The document includes extensive excerpts from Florida statutes detailing the stringent registration and monitoring conditions for sexual offenders, including in-person reporting, address verification, and limitations on residence and employment.
